text: (bright upbeat music)

- WIND Hellas is the third
largest telecommunications
provider in Greece.
We provide 4G and 5G mobile services,
we provide fiber connections,

we provide IT services
to residential customers,

to business customers, and
also to the public sector.

WIND Hellas has more
than 3 million customers
that we serve in Greece,

and we have more than
500 million in revenues.

WIND Hellas simply wants to
be the most customer friendly
telecommunications operator in Greece.

We made our first strides
in moving to the AWS cloud
with our WIND Vision pay TV service,

which we launched three
and a half years ago.
And to be focused here on the back office,

which is the system that
maintains all subscriber data,
all program data.

So each time a customer
does a zapping event,

the system will check
through the back office,

is the subscriber allowed
to view that channel?
What is the title of the program?
Is recording allowed?
Can you watch it on a mobile device?

It's a lot of information
that within milliseconds
of a zapping has to go back and forth.

We run our pay TV service
with 75,000 subscribers.
These subscribers make on an average day
15 million calls to the back office.

And this is obviously a
mission critical service
that can also have very high peak loads

when you have a typical football
match between top teams,
this can increase very rapidly
and our system must support it.

It was perfect for us in
a rapidly scaling business

to put this critical
system into the AWS cloud.

We have expanded our
usage of the AWS cloud.
So any new development of web applications

that our digital team does are
being performed on AWS cloud.
The comfort of a scalability,
we don't have to worry about capacity,
we don't have to provide a peak load
in a legacy data systems.
Whenever we need capacity we have it.

WIND allows users more
than 20 services of AWS,
this includes Amazon EC2, Amazon DynamoDB,
AWS IoT is of high importance
for us for mission-critical applications.
AWS has made our life much easier
because we don't have to worry
about several operations anymore.
It's just there in the cloud to activate.

AWS provides our developers
with the latest tools
that they already know.
They are familiar with the AWS cloud.

So any new developer has a
much shorter onboarding time
and can be productive immediately.

So we can build our web
applications faster,
we have more flexibility,

and also more capabilities
in our new web developments.
On top of that, the reliability.
We're running a paid TV service.
This is literally live TV.

So reliability is of
really, really essence
for the reputation of our company.

And with AWS it's been a
hundred percent uptime so far.
(bright upbeat music)
